column1: Lou Malnati's Pizzeria////Let's start with the tomato. Clear as day
column3: Lou's pours on tomatoes in a chunky fashion that's not for the faint of heart. They contribute to hefty pieces that get saucy when handled. On top is a thick layer of cheese which is so well-prepared
column4: it could stand to be a meal on its own. I personally love the crunchy
column8: leaves room for more pizza. There are locations throughout the city and I've found the consistency to be rather reliable. Gino's East doesn't stand a chance
column9: whereas Giordano's is something you'd have to determine for yourself. Dine in
